name: Top Ten Best Looking Male Stars of All Time Trivia Game | Celebrities | 10 Questions

questions.text: This man got his start playing the title character in "Doogie Howser, M.D.". Who is this gorgeous man?
questions.explanation:
Neil Patrick Harris.

	Neil Patrick Harris was born on June 15, 1973. He got his big start with "Doogie Howser, M.D." He married David Burtuka, another actor, in 2014. The couple have adopted children. He was also in "The Smurfs" and "The Smurfs 2" movies playing the part of Patrick Winslow.

questions.text: What Cuban actor and band leader was divorced because one woman was just not enough?
questions.explanation:
Desi Arnaz.

	Desi Arnaz and his wife Lucille Ball were married for 20 years. Finally she could not take his cheating any longer and they divorced. Throughout the rest of his life (he died in 1986) they remained very good friends. He played Ricky Ricardo, Lucy's husband, on "I Love Lucy" from 1951-1957. He was also in the movie "The Long, Long Trailer" playing the part of Nicholas "Nicky" Collini.

questions.text: "Frankly my dear, I don't give a damn" but could you tell me anyway what good looking actor said these words years ago?
questions.explanation:
Clark Gable.

	Clark Gable was born on February 1, 1901. He was active in acting from around 1931 until 1960, the year he died. Clark Gable is probably best remembered as Rhett Butler in "Gone with the Wind". This film was not the first film to use "damn" it was used in "Cavalcade" in 1933 and "Pygmalion" in 1938. His last movie was "The Misfits", made in 1961, where he played the role of Gay Langland.

questions.text: This man, born in Tasmania, was known to be a huge womanizer.  He was also accused of two cases of statutory rape. Who was he?
questions.explanation:
Errol Flynn.

	Errol Flynn was born on June 20, 1909. He died 50 years later from a heart attack. He became an American citizen in 1942. He was known for playing characters like Robin Hood. His first movie in 1933 was "In the Wake of the Bounty" where he played Fletcher Christian. His final role was that of The American Correspondent in the movie "Cuban Rebel Girls" which was released in 1961.

questions.text: Starring with Julia Roberts in "Pretty Woman" this man continues to look good even as he ages as seen years later when he was in "Chicago". Who is this man?
questions.explanation:
Richard Gere.

	In "Pretty Woman" Gere played a guy who buys and breaks up companies and then sells the pieces to other companies. He met Vivian (Roberts) who was a hooker and at first it was just sex, but soon they fell in love with each other. In "Chicago" Billy Flynn played a lawyer for Roxie Hart (Renée Zellweger), who was accused of killing her husband.

questions.text: What man has a tattoo that says "Scotland Forever"?
questions.explanation:
Sean Connery.

	Sean Connery was born August 25, 1930 in, as you may have guessed by his tattoo, Scotland. He also has another tattoo that says Mum and Dad. He has retired from acting but still does voice overs sometimes. Sean Connery is probably best known for playing James Bond in some of the "James Bond" movies including "Dr. No" and "From Russia with Love". He was also in other movies including "The Medicine Man" where he played Dr. Robert Campbell.

questions.text: What actor said (or yelled) the famous line in "Braveheart" "FREEEEEDOM!"?
questions.explanation:
Mel Gibson.

	Mel Gibson was born on January 3, 1956 in Peekskill, NY. He started his acting career in 1976 with the movie "The Sullivans" where he played Ray Henderson. He was also in the "Lethal Weapon" movies where he played the part of Martin Riggs. He is also an accomplished director and producer. He produced and directed the movie "The Passion of the Christ" which came out in 2004.

questions.text: This man was once very slim and attractive and yelled the line "STELLA!". As he grew older he became a very heavy set man, who was he?
questions.explanation:
Marlon Brando.

	Marlon Brando was almost every girls' fantasy back in the 50s and 60s. By the time he got older however he had gained a lot of weight and no longer had that sex appeal. The movie in which he yells "STELLA!" was "A Street Car Named Desire". He also was in the musical "Guys and Dolls" where he played Sky Masterson a gambler. He was in "The Freshman" playing the role of Carmine Sabatini. He was probably best known as Don Vito Corleone in "The Godfather" Trilogy.

questions.text: This man had a long career from 1982-2014. Despite many other memorable roles he is probably best known as Severus Snape. Who is this man?
questions.explanation:
Alan Rickman.

	Alan Rickman was born on February 21, 1946 in London, England. He appeared in movies such as "Die Hard" and "Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves". In the "Harry Potter" series he played Severus Snape a professor at Hogwarts and head of the Slythern House. Sadly Rickman died on January 14, 2016 from pancreatic cancer.

questions.text: Who was married to Lisa Niemi from 1975 until his death in 2009?
questions.explanation:
Patrick Swayze.

	Patrick Swayze was born in Texas on August 18, 1952. He met his future wife Lisa at his mother's dance studio. He died on September 14, 2009 of pancreatic cancer. In 1979, he landed his first acting role as Ace Johnson in "Skatetown U.S.A.". He got his big break when he played Johnny Castle in "Dirty Dancing" in 1987. In 1990, he played the role of Sam Wheat in "Ghost". His last acting appearance before his death was in the 2009 TV series "The Beast" where he played Charles Barker.
